TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ElementInformation extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains meta-information about an individual element within the configuration. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ElementInformation object contains meta-information about an individual element within the configuration. This object can be used when validating and changing the properties of an individual element.
## Examples The following example shows how to get the ElementInformation associated with a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement> object.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#80](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.configuration.e_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#80](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.configuration.e_1.vb)]
The following excerpt shows the configuration used by the previous code example.
``` <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <configuration> <configSections> <section name="MyUrls" type="Samples.AspNet.UrlsSection, ConfigurationElement, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" allowDefinition="Everywhere" allowExeDefinition="MachineToApplication" restartOnExternalChanges="true" /> </configSections> <MyUrls name="MyFavorites"> <simple name="Contoso" url="http://www.contoso.com" port="8080" /> <urls> <clear /> <add name="Microsoft" url="http://www.microsoft.com" port="0" /> </urls> </MyUrls> </configuration> ```

Docs.summary: Gets the errors for the associated element and subelements
Docs.value: The collection containing the errors for the associated element and subelements

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Errors collection.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#89](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_5_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#89](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_5_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the associated object is a collection.
Docs.value: if the associated object is a collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the IsCollection property.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#81](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_8_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#81](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_8_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the associated object cannot be modified.
Docs.value: if the associated object cannot be modified; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IsLocked property returns `true` when the related element is locked by the <xref:System.Configuration.SectionInformation.AllowOverride%2A>, <xref:System.Configuration.SectionInformation.AllowDefinition%2A>, or <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.LockAllAttributesExcept%2A> property.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the IsLocked property.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#82](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#82](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_2_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the associated object is in the configuration file.
Docs.value: if the associated object is in the configuration file; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the IsPresent property.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#83](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#83](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_0_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the line number in the configuration file where the associated object is defined.
Docs.value: The line number in the configuration file where the associated object is defined.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the LineNumber property.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#84](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_7_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#84](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_7_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the properties in the associated object.
Docs.value: A collection of the properties in the associated object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties of a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement> object are the attributes and subelements associated with that configuration element in the configuration file.
## Examples The following example shows how to get the Properties collection.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#85](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_4_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#85](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_4_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the source file where the associated object originated.
Docs.value: The source file where the associated object originated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement> object may be created in a default state, in which case this property returns `null`.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Source property.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#86](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#86](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_1_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the associated object.
Docs.value: The type of the associated object.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Type property.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#87](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#87](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_3_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the object used to validate the associated object.
Docs.value: The object used to validate the associated object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A validator object is not required, and this property may return `null`.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Validator property.
[!code-cs[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#88](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.e_6_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement#88](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.e_6_1.vb)]
